article.title: Mutually touching infinite cylinders in the 3D world of lines

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the chirality value (+1 or -1) represent in this figure?
choices: The distance between the two lines.
The angle between the two lines.
The direction of rotation from the covering line to the covered line.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the matrix K5 represent in the context of this article?
choices: A possible chirality matrix for a 7-knot.
A forbidden chirality matrix for mutually touching cylinders.
The Ring matrix for a specific 7-cross configuration.
The rotation matrix used for positioning elliptic cylinders.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the invariant â„˜(P, R) aim to describe in this article?
choices: The volume of the parallelotope formed by the cylinder axes.
The number of rings surrounding a specific cylinder.
The unique topological characteristics of an n-cross or n-knot configuration.
The aspect ratio of elliptic cylinders in a 10-knot configuration.

multiple_choice_question.text: What specific configuration of cylinders does this figure illustrate?
choices: A 7*-knot, a unique configuration of seven equal, mutually touching cylinders.
